Reviews.Title: “To be avoided!”
Reviews.Author: swisspigs
Reviews.Content: When the room costs EUR 250+ a night and during two of three mornings you have cold water only, the room smells from the sinks because it has obviously not been used for a few days, at the very congested breakfast room you get plastic cups for concentrated, sweet orange juice, there is only one TV channel, there is no WiFi in the room as advertised, one of us got stuck in the lift and there is no manager to be reached, then you are at the Trevi Hotel in Rome. We understand now why they cashed the rate for the whole three nights in the beginning of the stay. This hotel is a joke and the only good thing is its location near the Trevi Fountain. PS: We have not received any apology for all of what is being described here and more got the feeling that we are guilty for all what has happened...

Reviews.Title: “A joke”
Reviews.Author: Lynda L
Reviews.Content: We had the choice of room on the level beside the elevator. Declined as there was no'window' Told to go and get something to eat until the bell hop came back. Arrived back and he eventually turned up and told us that our luggage was on ther 5th floor, no lift. After getting to the ' hotel annexe' and reaching fourth floor passing open walls which housed electric appliances. Not in the first flush of youth we decided to go back to the first room offered on the understading that a new room would be mmade available for us in the morning. Daylight arrived and the view had been doctored by some sorry looking plants to cover the pipes which ran down the side of the 'window which faced onto a brick wall.' The breakfast room was totally awful. Too many tables cramed in and not enough room to sit down. The fresh orange juice was diluted orange. Coffee eventually arrived cold. Continental breakfast wasn't replenished. We were eventually decanted to one of the other hotels in the group which was slightly better. Breakfast room again was tiny with only 5 tables. One lovely young lady seemed to serve breakfast and clean out all of the rooms. I definately would not recommend any of this groups hotels

Reviews.Title: “the only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: m l
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, when we arrived we were told that the our room is in a different building, which is a couple of meters away, and it's on the 2nd floor without elevator, the rooms wasn't ready yet so we asked the receptionist to recommend a restaurant while we're waiting for the room, she recommended a bad tourist restaurant that was a pure waste of money. when our room was finally ready we found out that it was not a 2nd but a 3rd floor with no lift. the building is in one of the alleys going from the Trevi fountain and is always crowded and noisy at night. the breakfast was ok, but i've had a lot better from a 3 star hotel. the air conditioner wasn't cooling, the reception gave us some explanation that's it's not summer yet so the conditioning can only work on heat. one of the windows didn't open and even though we asked it to be fixed they didn't. in the second day the key card didn't work and we had to go down to the main hotel to sort it out

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL TREVI ASSISTED IN TRAFFIC SCAM”
Reviews.Author: hsmithconsulsv
Reviews.Content: Upon entering Rome on March 17, 2011, we turned over our car to the Hotel Trevi to park it for us overnight at an off-site garage. They charged us 50 Euro for the service. Following our return to the U.S., we received a notice from Hertz that my credit card had been charged for a parking violation. Apparently, the Hotel Trevi attendent had parked the car illegally. On Feruary 20, we recieved an official citation from the Rome Police stating that we were being fined 101.41 Euro for "driving in a limited traffic area without authorization." At no time was the car in our possession when the so-called violations occurred. Furthermore, we were never stopped by the police nor issued any citation while driving in or out of Rome. My only conclusion is that the Hotel Trevi and Hertz are complicit in committing fraud upon us for violations that occurred while the Hotel Trevi was in possession of our car. This sort of fraud is common throughout Italy (Google Traffic Fraud Italy) and can only happen with the complicity of hotels and rental car companies. Our experience with the Hotel Trevi was terrible and the staff was rude and unaccommodating. The breakfast meal was of inmate quality. I am a writer and will make sure the unwitting visitors to Rome are made aware of the poor food, service and fraudulent behavior of the Hotel Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Scam!”
Reviews.Author: Pro1993
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel only to find that they had no room for us... the receptionist didnt appologise and told us to either stay in one of their other hotels for one night or stay in a different one for the whole of our holiday. We decided on the one night hotel and an hour later someone came to collect us and our lugage. We were taken to a huge dark and very cold building with a blackened out door,no reception and no lighting. All that appeared to be in the building was a 6 story marble scarcase and a lift. My first thaught being, 'if you fell down these stairs, there's absolutly no one to help you.' We were taken to the top floor in a room that looked out to a wall... a wall covered in duckting and pipes. The shower fell off the wall when i turned it on, i turned on a tube light to find that it had previously snapped in half and had a nasty shock from it, the toilet was full of rust it was just awful. Although Trevi Hotels are B&B's we were offered no breakfast that morning and spent another hour waiting for a taxi to take us back to the original hotel. Once in the hotel we were happy to find that we had a real carpet, someone on reception incase you needed them and a proper shower. There was always a funny smell coming from the bathroom but after putting towels over the plug holes and keeping the fan on we managed to air out the room. Id never noramlly moan about where i stay, im one for camping and sleeping in the countryside but when you pay such a high amount... you expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Have Them Park Your Car!!”
Reviews.Author: annafla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Trevi last March 17, 2011. We paid for parking - about $50 US dollars for one night of overnight parking. About July 2011, we received a charge on our credit card from Hertz for a parking ticket!! They parked our car illegally!! Today, we received a summons from the police in Rome, stating that we owed 101 euros for going the wrong direction. The ticket was given AFTER we had passed our car off to the Hotel Trevi employees!!! So in all total, we paid will have paid (we are not paying the last charge!!) about $200 to park our car with Hotel Trevi for one night!!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit grody”
Reviews.Author: Liam W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an incredibly crowded and extremely loud area. We were put in a separate building which was very loud, had no elevator, and smelled so putrid that we requested to be moved from the building after one night. As it is adjacent to the Trevi Fountain, it stays noisy until the early hours of the morning. The staff was accommodating, but I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: denis b
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome on the 27/1/12 witch is a great place we was there this time last year. We stayed at the hotel Trevi and as we booked a year ago was very disappointed with the room. We where placed up a side street in room 502 the room had no window and my wife hated it,we had 2 single beds and things didn't work,the room was well worn and i would say 2 star.keep in mind we booked a year ago and still didn't get what we booked. Sleep quality was terrible scooters , taxis, fly pitchers running up and down most of the night. the worst of all this bloody great bell chiming the time at 15 minute intervals 24 hours a day. a nightmare. Breakfast was ok but not to our taste the staff where ok and had no problems apart from they would run out of things and not replace them. Position was great and all the sites where easily accessible, we buy a tour bus ticket and metro ticket and that gets you just about every where. Would i stay at this hotel again NO your spoilt for choice in this area so do your homework. Just to finish we where not looked after by Thomson over charged for rooms and conned on the exchange rate we could have got 40 euros more for £500 in the airport. also book your parking on line its half price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and helpful property”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Trevi was about 10 steps from the Trevi Fountain. It served as a good base to walk to all the main sights, eating areas and a short cab ride from Termini Rome train station (30 minute walk). It was also a short walk to the main shopping streets and buses. There are a variety of buildings around the Trevi Fountain that are part of the hotel; all were only a 1 or 2 minute walk from the reception building. We stayed in a room in a building away from the main building and a very friendly hotel bell hop carried the suitcases up all the stairs. The bathroom was large, with heated towel racks. The room was clean and also had a safe and refrigerator. In the reception, a computer was available for use with internet access and wifi was able to be purchased, however wifi was only accessible if you stayed in the main hotel building. One thing to remember, which staff inform you of on check in, is that when visiting key sites, such as the colosseum and Vatican, their security machines may deactivate your key and therefore its a good idea to drop by reception before returning to your room to ensure it is still activate. When asked for assistance and local knowledge on shopping, site seeing and booking airport transfers, all reception staff were very helpful. Overall, a great location, service and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but Basic”
Reviews.Author: Davide L
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Rome staying at the Hotel Trevi. Our visit to Rome was for sight seeing purposes and this hotel was superbly placed within 30 seconds of the splendid Fontana De Trevi. The hotel is also 15 minutes walk from the Colosseum, 10 minutes walk from Spanish Steps and 30 minutes from Vatican City. The hotel is basic but didn't pay a fortune for the room so expected it really. Breakfast was limited and the room was small but the two ladies were very helpful and worked hard. Check in was good and a street map provided which helps when getting around the streets. We opted for the airport shuttle bus from the airport (30 euro) for 2 people which was reasonable but we got the train back to the airport from Termimi Station (28 euro) for 2 people which was easy and a different experience. (Termini Station - 20 minute walk from hotel Trevi). Would certainly recommend Hotel Trevi but not if you want luxury, we wanted to see all the sights and we did it easily

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: KaeliZee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 2011 in the Colloseo room. Our room was just down the alley from the main lobby, about 20 steps away. We LOVED this hotel and it's location. Just around the corner from my favorite Roman attraction, the Trevi Fouintain. Our room was nice, but nothing fancy. It was very rustic feeling, with old wooden ceilings, but cozy. The morning breakfast was delicious. Lattes, cappuccinos, espressos, made to order. Great pastries and breads with meats and cheeses. On the roof of the building in modern and quaint decor, the view is beautiful! It's a great base point, because you are right in the heart of the city. My husband and I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: SPSCaterham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend break, staying at the Hotel Trevi. I was a little worried about staying at the hotel after reading some reviews. We stayed in room 515 which is situated in a little building around the corner. The bedroom was a good size, clean and with nice bathroom facilities. Breakfast is served in the main building on the roof top and there is plenty to keep you going for a days sightseeing! The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Jay T
Reviews.Content: We had some troubles with our room: tv out of order as the light near the bed. Breakfast ok but staff was rude. Anyway, Rome is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. but very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: chloe7944
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner came back on saturday. We had a lovely time in rome apart from the very rude and ill mannered people. Our hotel room was very clean all though it wasn't in the actual hotel it was up the street, the check in staff were very helpful, but the breakfast staff were terrible, very rude and wouldn't even serve us a drink, we were very disgusted by the two women which were there with there none exsisting help. brilliant location could of been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Shadow09Columbus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September while we were in Rome for 4 days. The hotel's location was the best! We walked everywhere and the hotel was very centrally located. The front desk staff were very helpful. We did end up staying down the street, not in the main hotel building, but the room was very clean, spacious, quiet, and up to date. The breakfast, located on the roof top in the main building was very nice, although don't get there too late - the staff will not like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Winegum0503
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights, room away from main hotel, only 30 Mtrs up the street in a separate building. Room on top floor, with roof terrace completely unexpected but wonderful. Breakfast is interesting, went out after first morning and had coffee at one of the many cafes. Room clean and bed comfortable, and great location. Staff very helpful, left luggage with them for the day as we had evening flight with no problems. Used the limo service to get to the airport, cost €52. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CarlEnnis
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the hotel, we were carted down the road to a room in what appeared to be an apartment building. Three locks to get into the building and room. Cleaning service was non-existant. Room looked more like a hostel than anything else(with the exception of the bath) which had been redone. Very noisy with a restaurant on the ground floor across the courtyard. We had to walk several blocks back to the hotel for the ?breakfast? which was not even appetizing, so we went elsewhere to eat. Staff was not helpful about much of anything. We wanted to take a cab back to the airport and they suggested thier shuttle service. There was no mention of cost so we made the assuption it was part of the hotel. A limo ride later we had a 80E bill. Unlike the other hotels we stayed at in Rome, we will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel - Heather and Linda”
Reviews.Author: Heather N
Reviews.Content: Good location, but that is about all we can say about this hotel. One particular member of staff was very rude. Our room was changed because it was in the basement and not in the hotel. There were no windows and smelt very damp. Our new room was marginally better and the breakfast room was poor as was the breakfast. No facilities to sit and have refreshments either in the room or in the hotel. Probably the worst city break hotel we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: Laari_Araujo
Reviews.Content: Trevi Hotel has a great location in Rome. Just next to Trevi Fountain and a walk of max 10 min to the Coliseum. The problem with its location was that it is found in a street so small that cars are not allowed, resulting in difficulties for those who travel with big and heavy bags. My family and I loved being so close to everything. Although the breakfast and the staff from the kitchen were great and really friendly with us, the people from the reception were often rude and wrong in information about tours. This resulted in a lot of trouble for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Euroedwards
Reviews.Content: Our room was located away from the hotel reception and the lift to the 5th floor level where the Trevi's rooms are in this building is so small.it defies description. Room was clean but very very small. Room service was done until about 4.30 and the mini bar never got restocked in our 4 day stay. Breakfast room is small and food is barely passable. No full breakfast available and the juices are just cordial. The room had no fire / smoke detector and there's no fire escape. If there's a fire in the hall and you're at the end of the hall like we were, you're screwed. Location is it's best (and really only) feature. The air con struggledbto keep the room cool in August and was noisy. We reported a broken shower rose and it was still broken when we left 4 days later.Two minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and there's a whole heap of great eating places around the local area. It's about a ten minute walk to the Spanish Steps. The hotel is way over priced and is charging what it charges because of it's location. Wifi is not free and beware of the Rome tax - 1 euro per person per night.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay in room 103 - AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: queenie60
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews and also those in teh book at the hotel and I can say that we really must have been unlucky. It was one of the WORST hotels I have ever stayed in. We booked this for the last leg of our honeymoon and stayed for 3 nights. We got room 103. It had a window but it looked out onto the gloomy pipes of the lift next door, literally there was no light at all and was actually scary! The room smelt of smoke despite there being signs up. I thik the smoke was coming from 104 next door. Disgusting. Shower needed a good clean and toilet smelt of wee. I looked into some other rooms as I was passing when they were being cleaned. They had nice views over the streets and to read other peoples' views makes me feel as if my husband and I were cheated. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone else. Very disappointed and sad to have had this experience when it seems others had a good time. I am not usually picky but honestly this room is just the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, cozy hotel. Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: willia_26
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel right near the Trevi Fountain. The staff was lovely. The room was really cool too. It was this big wooden door just around the corner, it almost looks like a garage door. The rooms are so nice inside though!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: Italytravelgirl77382
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to The Trevi Fountain and there is lots of noise but we had a room on the back side so it did not bother us. The breakfast was very good and the waitress was very nice. The night clerk when we arrived though was annoyed because he was talking on his cell phone and we bothered him checking in and asking questions but he was nice. The room was very nice. It is quite hard to find and I would not recommend staying here if you have a car. You have to go a little ways to a parking garage and we arrived late and it was difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Acceptable accomidations”
Reviews.Author: ScoutDad111
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and old, but were clean and well maintained, The room I had had two singles and a double, the Matress on the double was very soft, I would have had back pain the next day if I had slept in it, however my kids who prefer a soft matress liked it, and the singles were nice and firm, perhaps to firm for many. The elevator was small, and it took several trips to get our baggage up. The Staff was ok, helpful enough with directions and maps, one person spoke a little english. The Location is great, a block from the fountain, and pleasent 20 minute walk down to the colosseum I would recommend this place to travalers that prefer location over the quality of the room and don't want to spend a fortune for both.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shabs155019
Reviews.Content: We are an average family of 4 that spent 3 nights in the begining of July. After reading the reviews we decided to take a chance. The best thing about the hotel is the location which is superb. Close to many of the best parts of Rome you could walk to everything. Now the bad. The hotel is 2 star at best. Very small, just passable in cleanliness. The bathroom shower for us was 80 percent clogged so we would have to take a 2 minute shower or it would overflow. The water faucet would turn itself off as well so most of the 2 minutes were spent with no water coming out. They sent someone to fix it but he basically said it didn't work. We were also in the rooms off the main hotel which seem to garnish the most complaints. Seems like family of 4 go to that location. The key would always have to be remagnitized every day, so at the end of the day we would have to go the the office, remagnitize before we go around the corner to the rooms. In conclusion the location is amazing but the rooms are not great. Book based on what is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like living in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: ChelleRebel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Trevi Hotel for 4 nights. It was our first time in Rome, and we couldn't have a better first time!! We had a little problem finding the hotel because our taxidriver wasn't allowed to drop us in front of the hotel (one-way streets...), but thanks to a helpful waiter of a nearby restaurant we found it after a 10 minute walk. We were welcomed warmly and were told we had a room in another building. A bellboy and another employee accompanied us to the building. The bellboy immediately began a conversation with us about all the soccerteams he knew in Holland (we're from Amsterdam), very funny. When he showed us the dependance and the room we were stunned! The room was located in a beautiful old roman residence building nearby (less than 1 minute walk) . There was no security or reception, but the door only could only be opened with a code so it felt save. To get to the room we had to walk through a high marmer hall, our room was located on the first floor so we had to walk a small staircase, not a problem for us! The room itself was more like an appartment: a medium large hall, a small living room with a sink, mini-fridge, dishwasher and small cooking plate. Next to that room was the bathroom. It was small but sooooo beautiful and romantic and everything we needed was there: luxurious showerhead, toilet, bidet, gorgeous sink, hairdryer, mirror with cabinet behind it... To get to the bedroom we had to walk a small cute staircase, the bedroom itself was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. Only thing was that the ceiling wasn't very high in the doorways so we had to remember not to bump our heads. The appartment was furnished in antique style, very romantic like the bathroom. Throughout the appartment there was enough closetroom for the most heavy packed traveller. Every day our room was cleaned, bed made up and towels changed. We couldn't be more satisfied. The breakfast room at the top floor of the hotel was very small but very cosy, service was friendly and food was good. The location of the hotel is perfect, we walked everywhere! Even to Trastevere,Villa Borghese and Vatican City. I read reviews with complaints about not being in the hotelbuilding itself and about noise from the Trevi fountain area; we saw only benefits in being in a dependance because it was very quiet (no small hallways where people walk by the room throughout the night) and it felt like having your own appartment in Rome! We haven't experienced any noise at all from the Trevi fountain area (maybe because we were in the dependance...). I also read complaints about the employees but I can't say anything else than: excellent service!! We were reconized when we came at the reception room and it wasn't even necessary to say our room number: they already knew!! And when we used the internet to print our boarding passes we didn't get charged, very kind. So Trevi Hotel: thanks for the delightful stay! We know what hotel to choose when we come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cats68
Reviews.Content: Good location in Rome . I was booked into another hotel on arrivel i was told they had over booked so took me to one of their other hotels which was Hotel Trevi . The staff were very friendly . I had booked a double room for sole use when i arrive a Trevi i was given a single for the first night . The room was ok but i was awoke at 4.45am as the room was under the stairs for the breakfast room . The staff were up an down and talking . I then got moved to a double . Room was fine ok size for Rome but the shower very small . But no soundproofing so you could here everything from the other rooms . Good breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely convenient position for all sites would love to return to the Trevi”
Reviews.Author: pinacoladobabe
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 day visit to Rome. We both were first timers to Rome - we found the all of the staff charming and very helpful. he hotel provided us with a map and we found that we were within walking distance of lots of the sights eg: we had booked our Vatican trip for 14:15 in the afternoon so after breakfast we used our map and walked visiting many of the historic sights en route had a very good light lunch near the Vatican. We were pleased that we did'nt book the hopon/off bus as we feel we managed to see more in the 4 days than we would have seen by bus Booked through Thomas Cook/Cresta Breaks - the airport transport service was excellent booked 2 trips to the Vatican and Coliseum and surrounding areas and the guides were excellent. We were in another building the entrance being through a very strong door which led into a courtyard, the accomodation was very clean bedrooms upstairs bathroom downstairs - the stairs did not have a handrail and there was only one very small window in the smaller bedroom fortunately we are both agile but this accommodation would not be suitable for any guest that was physically disabled. We personally would reutn to the Hotel Trevi as we found all the staff very helpful and obliging and we partically loved this area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stripi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights end of April beginning of May. The location is fantastic and we were very pleased with the hotel - what we expected for a 3 star hotel. The rooms were small, but clean and very comfortable beds. The roof terrace, although small was lovely and breakfast was very good. We had an amazing time in Rome and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: bakerliza
Reviews.Content: Hotel Trevi was a great last minute find for a 3 day holiday in Rome. Perfect location on a side street about a 90 second walk to Trevi, so you miss the noise and congestion. It's about a 5-7minute walk from the metro. Very helpful staff, and quaint rooms. We stayed in an apartment-like room (minus hte kitchen) that was small, quaint, very clean, and perfect. Two women with large suitcases was about all the room could hold, but I will definately stay there on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: steffenCampinas
Reviews.Content: Before I left Brazil with my husband, I had most of the hotels of our trip to Italy prepaid. Hotel Trevi was one of then, regretfully. When we arrived we were also sent to another building close by, to a room on the 4th floor without an elevator. I thought that the poor guy who took our luggage upstairs would collapse. I almost did. I've read some reviews about this hotel on TA before our trip and I've told the travel agent that I didn"t want to be sent to another building, but it happened anyway. I'm overweight and it was very hard to climb all those stairs everyday, and when I 've tried to reason with the hotel clerk she just looked at me, as saying that the problem with the stairs was mine, not hers. It was a five days nightmarish stay, I thought I was going to have a heart attack every time I got to the room and nobody seemed to give a damn. The room was clean and ok, but nothing more than that. Also, staying this close to the Trevi Fountain wasn't such a good idea. Very noisy and quite hard to get any sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “location 5 stars, hotel 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: tmb22
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights at hotel, were put on 5th floor of old apartment block away from hotel up another side street, the lift barely took 2 persons and was very old, the room was ok, at least it was cleaned every day. Breakfast was a farce, the room was crammed full of tables, no room to move around, not enough staff to clear dirty plates and give you hot water for your tea, however the food was plentyful. The location of the hotel was perfect, 1 minute from the Trevi Fountain, we walked everywhere it only took us 45 mins to the Vatican and 25 to the Coloseum. A typical mid budget Rome hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel, you might not get what you expect”
Reviews.Author: DavidCinUK
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 double rooms at the Hotel Trevi. But, we didn't stay in the Hotel Trevi. It seems there is a practice of placing (probably those people least likely to complain) in other rooms and flats in nearby streets and they don't tell you this when you book. When we booked in, everyone in the lobby was waiting for their bags to be taken somewhere else other than the hotel. There were a lot of annoyed people. The location of the hotel seems to pull in lots of customers/guests that can never realistically be accommodated in the hotel. Even the breakfast room, located on the top floor of the hotel, is so small that it can't accommodate all the guests, best not to bother with breakfast (see the other tripadvisor reviews). Don't expect good service from the reception desk. If you prepay the hotel in full before you arrive and expect all the taxes to have been included as stated, you'll find this isn't the case. They'll still want more money from you for local taxes - so expect to pay twice! Also, don't challenge the hotel about anything, as they may get angry and aggressive as they did with me.

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL ISN`T WORRIED WITH THE GUESTS”
Reviews.Author: MARI21091982
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 2 nights in the hotel. We arrived there and the receptionists designated us to an outside room, an exterior dependence. The fact is that the room was not exactly a room, it was an old apartment in a common residential building, without a reception or any kind of security. And there was no phone in the room and also no internet available, as it wasn`t in the building of the hotel. The bathroom was really small. I didn`t feel comfortable. That wasn't what we were expecting. Despite of it, there was a receptionist very unfriendly and not available to help us in arranging a shuttle to the airport, because the hotel offers the service, but even more expensive then a taxi. And it is not close to the metro station, more than 1 km I think. The only positive aspect is that it is close to the Fontana di Trevi and Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: PolePositionTravel
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome many times and even lived there for 6 months. It cannot be denied that finding a good value central hotel in Rome can be a bit of a challenge. To be honest, booking a hotel so close to one of the top tourist attractions in Rome, and having read other reviews here, I was a bit nervous. More so because we were driving there... On arrival all worries were pretty immediately extinguished. We simply parked in the tiny alley in front of the hotel, they arranged for a valet to whisk the car away (and return it on time the next day); and showed us to our utterly charming room. Frankly I think our off season visit in freezing January helped the room choice, as we obviously had a free upgrade to a superior room (with a private, although under the circumstances unusable, garden!); I would recommend going Superior on this one. The location is incredible. 30 seconds to the Trevi Fountain, 10 minute walk to the Pantheon, 15 to the Forum. Scads of great pubs and restaurants within 5 minute walk. Staff super helpful, speaking many languages. Comments about the breakfast have some validity - it is a bit cramped, and typical European 3* breakfast (what do you expect?); however anything negative is made up for by the great rooftop view! On my next trip for Rome (hopefully leisure and not business!) wouldn't think of booking anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: englishchap1900
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it is my understanding that the hotel has more than one site, both very close to each other on close streets but i've heard the rooms differ slightly. I can only speak for the off-the-main-reception-site where we stayed, and there were many other rooms here. It was only one street up from reception and like the other site literally seconds from the fountain. Our room was not large but was extremely cosy. We had a nice little balcony with a pleasent view down the street. The bathroom was absolutely lovely and romantic. The bed was comfortable. Location was brilliant, amongst the best in Rome surely. Noise was not a major problem. Nothing bad to say about the hotel rooms, however our room key card failed not once but twice! Our electricity did go once too. Luckily, the staff were very efficient at recitifying all problems very quickly and it in no way detracted from our lovely experience with the hotel. A very nice little place and great value for money. Also had a slightly romantic feel about if for the couples out there. My girlfriend loved it. I would recommend it to any like minded travellers who like to be in a good location where they can take in the city inexpensively and have a nice, simple but pleasant room waiting for them in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and tiny”
Reviews.Author: chumoka
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the reviews below - overpriced, tiny little rooms, the 'double' beds are so narrow that you would always wake your partner up when you turn, the bathroom is a complete joke... For breakfast you have a 'wide' selection of about 6 ingrediences. It's 4* prices for (maximum) 2* services... Yeah, the location is perfect though.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing was the location”
Reviews.Author: Pat186565
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with the previous comments especially concerning the roof terrace.This had attracted us to the hotel but it was a huge disappointment. On our first morning we arrived for breakfast around 9am to find every table laden with dirty dishes. The staff were obviously struggling to keep up with the demands for coffee and hot water for tea. The juice machine was producing watered down juice made from a powder mixture. On the plus side our room although quite small was very clean and adequate as a base and the location was perfect. We wouldn't use this hotel again or recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Discouraging attitudes by most staff did not make us feel welcome.”
Reviews.Author: Beemer02
Reviews.Content: We checked-in early and were assigned decent rooms. When we returned later for our keys, they had moved us to much poorer rooms. Our complaints were met with a barrage of Italian language and flinging of papers on the front counter - quite immature and embarrassing really. We generously tipped two porters when we arrived, and were told later when we returned for our keys, that we were expected to carry our luggage up to our rooms. The breakfast area is very tight and cramped. The hotel's clean and in a great location, though!

Reviews.Title: “Abrasive front desk manager -poor to non existent customer service skills”
Reviews.Author: PaulCTripTip
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the middle aged female front desk manager was so negative we will not return to this hotel, unless she is gone. She was the most unhelpful know-it-all ever. (Minor example: where can we find an ATM or bank? - Answer: I have no idea. Really? You run a hotel that is suppose to assist your guests. Also, no change, no money exchange, no stamps, nothing. Always no no no! Other guests were equally turned off. She became the talk of the guests because she was such a piece of work,. Her approach/abrasiveness/twisted facts and truths were her main issues.) Anyway, we were placed in a building other than the main hotel which suited us fine. The room was small, cozy, dark but clean with a relatively new bathroom. That was good. We were located a stones throw from Trevi Fountain. If you want to stay in a neighborhood with cafes, restaurants, shops all around you, then this is a good location. Good value, sans the customer service. Breakfast was fine-though the room was sardine packed and extremely hot! (Like a hot house for plants) I'd give it a qualified recommendation, as management really needs to address their customer service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: Wonkyknees
Reviews.Content: Imagine stepping out of your hotel, looking down the street and seeing the Trevi Fountain! This is an extremely well-located hotel and we were able to walk to everything except The Vatican. We stayed in their annex - just up the street in an apartment building. Our room was very recently renovated with ultra-modern finishings throughout. The bathroom was very nice. We had a view over the rooftops of Rome and could actually see part of the Victor Emmanuel monument. Although we thought we were used to small elevators in European hotels, this one was tiny. It carried 2 people at a time or 1 person with 1 suitcase. Charm? Of course, and one always has the option of taking the stairs - to the 6th floor. We had to walk about 100 metres to the main building for breakfast. While the food selection was satisfactory, the rooftop breakfast room is charming but far too small and crowded for the number of people they are serving. A warning to guests with mobility issues: although the hotel has an elevator, the final ascent to the breakfast room is by way of a flight of steep winding stairs. The girls at the front desk deserve particular commendation for booking excursions, confirming flights and booking restaurants all in an efficient, friendly way. We arrived in Rome at the central station and chose to take the Metro to Barberini and then walk the rest of the way. Theoretically this sounded good in the planning stage. We soon discovered that the Rome Metro has too many stairs, too few escalators and elevators, and too many long passageways for middle-aged travellers with luggage. We hired a limo for the return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts!”
Reviews.Author: Scottishvoyager
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed near the Trevi Fountain, and the staff were very friendly and helpful ---- BUT The breakfast room is totally inadequate. It makes for a very unpleasant start to the day to have to squeeze and sidle past other people to reach your breakfast, and although adequate, the food was not very good. Even when seated you were far too close to the next table, and when someone wanted to get up to collect their buffet food, others often had to move to allow you to get through. Although we had asked for our room to be adjacent to that of our friends, we were at first not even in the same building, and we were shown into what is probably the room described previously as being dark and without a window in the bedroom area - very dingy and unpleasant. We refused this and asked to be moved. We were then shown to a very pleasant, spotless room at least in the same building as our friends, just round the corner from the main hotel building. Before we could recommend this hotel to friends, we would want to be sure that none of them would be offered the first room we saw, and that something had been done about the breakfast arrangements. A pity, because the refurbished rooms were pleasant and clean,the staff helpful and the hotel well placed for visiting the many wonderful sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not only the best location but fantastic service and so clean, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Suebee068
Reviews.Content: Such a great location, you can go see the Trevi Fountain each morning on your way out and again in the evening. The staff at the hotel are so nice and helpful, they helped make our stay a complete pleasure. So wonderful to be in the center of all the sights that you want to see. Would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location but be careful about getting what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Small_Bean
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Hotel Trevi from 29th August and found the location of the hotel absolutely wonderful in terms of being our base from which to explore the city, not to mention the few metres is really is from the beautiful Trevi Fountain. We booked through Expedia and thought we had good a good deal for a Junior Suite for our stay, and had even checked thoroughly by email with the hotel about exactly what the room would be like as from their website photos were expecting it to be pretty amazing. Despite this we did not get the room we paid for as were advised that it was in fact a Suite not a Junior Suite yet in reception they display photos of it as a Superior room that you can upgrade to for an additional €30 per night so all rather confusing as the website shows the same room to be titled the Minerva Suite. Anyway we ended up with room 515 Spagna which we kept being assured was the junior suite, to be fair this room was very clean, cool and comfortable but did not have any lounge type space as you would expect of a suite or junior suite. It was in the building just to the side of the main hotel building so still perfect in terms of location. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful to us throughout our stay, we never found the roof top terrace that is pictured on the website showing an area you can relax in overlooking the rooftops of the city with a glass of wine after a lot of walking and were told that they only had the breakfast room up at the top with the panoramic windows and this was not accessible to guests after the breakfast session has finished so were a bit confused about this. We chose this hotel as thought by having the junior suite and the roof top terrace there would be areas in which we could relax without having to be in our room or out all day so this was a shame but we were out so much as there is so much to see and do in the fantastic city that Rome is that we decided not to dwell on this, it was just a bit annoying! The breakfast was fine, quite basic but you could have as much as you liked and most of the staff serving it were very welcoming, given that the room is very small for the number of tables that are laid out in it, they have to work hard to get around in there and it gets very hot. We had ours between 930 and 10am most days and it was fine by then, probably after the rush! We found getting around in Rome really easy, it isn't really necessary to use the buses or the metro that much as its easy walking and everything is located quite close by to each other, the streets are smooth cobbles so a decent pair of comfortable shoes is a must! We loved Rome, both by day and night and will definitely return, it is very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but..........”
Reviews.Author: lee2407
Reviews.Content: I failed to read any reviews so I was unaware of the experience I was about to recieve. In fairness we arrived early so the room was not ready. The lady behind the desk allowed us to leave our bags so we could go for a walk round. The Trevi fountain was only seconds away from the hotel. Stunning and very busy. We then went and checked in the hotel and went to our room. Room 107. It was ............compact. In order to unpack me and my partner had to perform a choreographed routine in order to pass each other. We freshened up and left to explore Rome and all its wonderful charms. We returned in the evening and decided a shower was in order. Two things about the shower. Don't drop the soap and prepare to cool down rapidly. And now time to sleep. The bed is against the wall which is very uncomfortable. We left the window open to find Rome wakes up very early and in the narrow streets voices are very loud. A shower to start the day seamed like a good idea. I think it would have been warmer if I could have baved in the Trevi Fountain. We then attempted breakfast. The breakfast room is on the roof terrace on the fith floor. You could use the lift which is about the size of a shoe box........ The breakfast room has more tables than space, all of them full, no room to move so we returned downstairs and decided to eat out. We did managed to squeeze in for breakfast the next day which for me was not worth the pain. In fairness the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Everyone I dealt with spoke good english. By far it was not an unhappy experience . Rome is an amazing city well worth visiting but be prepared for the prices. Eating in the restaurants is expensive and most charge service charges on top. I recomend the free tours which meet oustide Mcdonalds just along from the Spanish steps (www.romefreetour.com). For me the Trevi was just part of the experience. It is in a fabulous location in walking distance of all the main attractions. There is a major police presence around the city which makes you feel pretty safe.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean room; at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: De_Frank
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at 50 meter from the Trevi fountain, one of the central tourist spots in Rome. It is located in a pedestrian zone, but a taxi can take easily take you to the hotel. Excellent location from where you can explore the city. Nearest metro station at Bamberini Sq. is at less than 10 minutes by foot. I was staying in a single room on the 4th floor. The room and bathroom were small, but well equiped (every square centimeter was utilized). The room was very clean and everything was in working order, with exception of the room safe. It was very quiet, so catching a good night sleep was not a problem at all. Breakfast was OK but nothing special. It was served on the fifth (top) floor in a room which was overcrowded as breakfast was served there not just for the hotel guests, but also for those guests that stayed in nearby apartments. Room rate was very affordable, taking into account that you're in such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Rome wasn't built in a day - The Hotel Trevi may have been!”
Reviews.Author: ABZ67
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews after booking the Trevi through BA holidays I immediately contacted them to make them aware of my many concerns. The booking agent assured me that the comments on TripAdvisor were a small percentage of travellers and all was well with hotel. An email was sent to tell the hotel I had concerns. (how that would have helped I dont know) Having tramped through the Metro system going up and down stairs for no apparent reason other than to enduce heart attacks in travellers with 30kg suitcases I arrived at the Trevi. The hotel is located down an alleyway in the centre of the city a coin's throw from the Trevi Fountain. Behind the reception counter we found 'Franco' a hotel employee being very careful to explain to an American father and son duo on how to travel around Rome. He went into great detail to ensure there were no misunderstanding; this took around 15 minutes whilst I waited to check in. Finally Franco turned his attention to my 'glowing' partner and her sweating rhino that was me. Franco's attention to detail and customer service matched that of the previous guests and having past me a number of tissues to save dripping over his counter went on to explain that we were very lucky to have one of the best rooms the hotel had to offer. So special that is was not in this particular hotel! (sound familiar?) Franco dressed this situation up with great flair and passion that I soon believed that I was in fact very lucky. The porter took our luggage out of the hotel with us in tow. Right out the door, left into the street, across the cross roads and finally covering no more that a 60 second walk we arrived at a large residential green door. We were on the 5th floor and to get there an elevator would be needed. This ancient elevator held a maximum of two people and was snug to say the least. The porter had to load up the elevator and squeeze himself like a pipe cleaner into the remaining space. We travelled ahead to ensure sufficient oxygen was available in such a small space. The room was a small appartment and met our needs. It was clean, fairly recently decorated (within 2 years) and allowed a breeze to flow through the rooms due to its elevated position. Not bad. Breakfast was served on the 4th floor of the hotel next morning. Again a very small service elevator took us up to the 'roof terrace.' This experience can only be described as an accident waiting to happen. The breakfast area held approx 15 tables and was so small it was hard to tell where one table ended and another started. The coffee was disgusting! I mean, really bad. It was a cheap instant coffee which I can only assume is what the hotel think Dutch, German, American and British people like to drink in a group environment. Mass poisoning I would say. My advise would be not to have the breakfast when booking this hotel. Get something from one of the nearby cafes and free up some space in the very small terrace garden for someone less fortunate. I spoke with two very jolly British ladies who said there room was small it was rediculous. This seems to be another familiar theme. My advice is that if you need a clean place to lay your head for a reasonable price this is it. If you want luxury, go elsewhere and pay twice the room rate. One last note about the apartment; there are no Fire evacuation notices displayed that I could see. It was an old building with multi occupancy and therefore this carries risks. There are routes however you should find and walk them yourself. And remember, don't take the lift, both of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Noora79
Reviews.Content: We had only two days to spend in Rome and we wanted to see as much as possible. Trevi Fountain was one of our main attractions so Hotel Trevi was a good choice. We were lucky to get a bigger room from another building witch was only one block away from the main building. Our room was nice, but the corridor wasn't. The smell was quite bad there. Our breakfast was good, but the breakfast room is very small. If the hotel is fully booked, there might not be enough space to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KBHWrexham
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central location and this was superb. We were worried after reading the reviews, however we were pleasantly surprised. We were housed in the dependancy - these are rooms outside the hotel in the narrow steets nearby. At first we were upset, but the room we were give was clean, roomy and had everything we needed except a view as the window was high up. I think these rooms were previously lock ups which have been converted. We had to go to the hotel each morning for breakfast. This was great, there is a huge selection and you could help yourself to anything - the views were delightful - you can see all over the rooftops. We walked everywhere and ate lots of ice cream - Italian is the best of course. Of course Rome is expensive it is the same in most cities, but we were expecting that. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Central location website deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Jackieg_10
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel forewarned by comments on this site so was not surprised to be directed to a room away from the main hotel.Taxi from station exspensive 28 Euros and not dropped at entrance to hotel.Hotel not easy to find. Staff were efficent but not over friendly,bags however were carried to new apartment which was quiet and clean.Bathroom very very small,I am only 5ft 2 and could only just shower and sit on the toilet! Would be no good for young children or elderly. Only had breakfast one day,very small room and roof top views of TV Aerials! Glad to be out of main hotel and apartment was central and convieneient for all the sites.I think the website is very misleading in its room descriptions. Rome is lovely but very exspensive .Watch out for hidden service charges on meals etc.

Reviews.Title: “For a short stay, central location overcomes flaws”
Reviews.Author: sthkiwi
Reviews.Content: Great location: Excellent central start point for great walks.Staff were helpful, spoke English and friendly. Many rooms are across a narrow lane --not sure what they are like. Shower tiny (how to pick up the soap??) and bathroom small. Bed had walls on 3 sides-climb over your partner. Breakfast good, but just coped at peak time. Do not use their shuttle contractor -- took 2hrs 40 min to airport. Would stay again, but check elsewhere too. However, location great for first visit to Rome. Internet at a small cost ,but a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “good trip”
Reviews.Author: NewportSightseer
Reviews.Content: Good location room a bit small but everything ok. Furnishings nice very clean, breakfast ok plenty of everything. Saw reports of previous guests was a bit concerned but i found it all good. Rome easy to walk to. Sistene chapel a must although lots of rooms to go through before you get to it. It is in the Vatican museum, got a bit confused trying to find it. Easy to get to hotel from Campino Airport without paying 60+ euros. We bought a return ticket on easyjet plane for 8 euros . The bus is waiting for you outside the terminal on the left, people were very helpful. that bus will get you to the termini where you can catch a taxi for 25 euros but we caught the no 175 bus to the via corsa. for 1 euro You get your ticket form a little booth in front of the bus station ,punch the ticket in the machine when you get on the bus. When you get to the stop (Corsa) cross the road on nearby crossing and walk down Via del murate (short walk, facing the tourist information box Via del Murate is on your left) towards the Trevi Fountain. Arriving at fountain with back to fountain take the road to the right of the church on the corner, go up past the chinese restaurant take immediate left, hotel 20 yards on the left. On return catch the 175 bus on the Via Corsa by the tourist information box . get your bus ticket from the tobbaci shop down the street to the left of the bus stop looking at the road. The timetable for returning to either airports is on the stand where you got off when you arrived at the airport. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did we walked everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Bother with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoFromPerth
Reviews.Content: The location was good and the photos of the rooms looked good, so we booked a superior room. We were not given one. Our room was small, dingy and the double bed was just two singles pushed together. When I said that our room was not like those advertised as 'Superior,' the man at the desk simply told me the pictures were of Suites. He was not telling the truth. We had been downgraded from Superior to a standard room with no refund as was evident by the rooms I viewed of friends I made while staying at the hotel. Judging by reviews on this site, the hotel appears to have a track record of failing to honour bookings. Instead, they house off site or simply downgrade with no refund. On the plus side, the location is good enough (there are many more in Rome that would be equally as good). The breakfast was also good, but there was no room to sit down. The negatives are many: we did not get the room we booked. No hot water in the shower if you rise later than 7:30, the hotel WiFi was not strong enough to reach our room and no refund was offered on the grounds we could sit in the lobby where WiFi is available. The lobby facilities are small and not comfortable, so extended work was not possible here. (There is no help with wireless connections: We were simply told 'No one else has problems connecting!') There are no irons, and no help getting shirts pressed externally or through the hotel service. For tourist purposes, this hotel is right around the corner from Trevi Fountain, but by personal preference I would pick other locations that would be more central. Fair enough, this is not a business hotel, but many other hotels in the area have a reliable internet (which is so necessary these days) that is free, and irons or some means of getting things pressed. I also felt the staff was dismissive rather than rude. There was no excuse for lying about our room being a 'Superior Room,' however and certainly none for collecting money for a service they did not provide. As an aside, the hotel staff warn you of pickpockets on public transport and steer you in the direction of a hop on - hop off bus company. Do not take this advice, the bus company Hotel Trevi recommends keeps its customers waiting at each stop for over an hour. There isn't time in Rome to bother with this. The public transport system is great, taking just standard precautions. The hop on hop off bus company to avoid is Ciao Roma. The Vatigan Tour that Trevi Hotel recommends should also be scruitinized carefully. The tour guide was lovely, but there are better sites in the Vatigan Museum than the Map Room and the tapestries. Do go with a company that leaves early, though! If you have time, shop around. If you do take the hotel's advice, don't bother rushing down from your 'early' breakfast....the tour company, Appian Way, will most likely keep you waiting to go, and come back, for over an hour.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a scam !!”
Reviews.Author: FWL1
Reviews.Content: We, like many others who book this hotel, I arrived to be told there has been a 'mistake' and that the only room they have for us is in a sister hotel, 10 minutes away. All the talk of good location on this site is true but the reality is you have a strong chance of not staying where you have booked. This is nothing short of a scam in my opinion with the sister hotel leveraging off the location of the Trevi hotel. I would strongly recommend not booking here if you want to be sure of your location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Christineab
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel I was told there was an error with my booking and I would need to spend my first night in another hotel near the train station, not what I wanted to hear considering i had just come from the train station. The hotel arranged my transport to and from the other hotel, (which was an upgrade on this hotel), when we got back the next day they upped our accommodation as an apology to a small apt about 50 metres from the hotel. It had its own courtyard, 2 bedrooms, great shower and was spotless. We only used the hotel for our breakfast, the breakfast room was very small, and the choice for breakfast was limited, but fresh. Staff extremely friendly and helpful, (we landed as the baggage handlers decided to strike so I was waiting a few days from my luggage), but the best thing about this hotel is its location, its about 20 metres from the Trevi fountain, its a bit difficult to find, our taxi driver left us at the trevi and we had to find the hotel ourselves ( its the road directly facing the fountain, look for the Chinese restaurant on the left, take the next immediate turn and the hotel is there)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DawnandErik
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a hotel apartment about 200 yds from the hotel which was lovely. Went in through huge doors into a courtyard with statues and fountains, felt very Roman. The apartment had a great shower and modern facilities, 2 tvs, comfortable bed and was fairly quiet. Only thing we didnt like was one very small window looking out onto a statue. We went to the hotel for breakfast every morning which was on the top floor. This really let the hotel down, only one person working so there was a long wait for tea and coffee, no butter for 2 days, no juice and no yoghurts one day. Not a 3 star breakfast. The hotel's location was fantastic, we walked to just about everywhere. Loads of places to eat and the streets felt quite safe at night. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great with minor exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Wilmington_NCTarheel
Reviews.Content: Best feature is the location -- the center of old Rome -- nearby streets safe day and night. Our room, in the main building, was large and clean with a comfortable bed; large bath room with lavatory, toilet, bidet, and shower (which was a little on the small size, but certainly adequate). Windows in bath and bedroom allowing cross ventilation. There was only slight to moderate street noise, which could be completely silenced by closing the window and shutters. Adequate to excellent service by the staff. The woman in the breakfast room was especially attentive, and the breakfast, which was served in a delightful sunroom on the top floor, was excellent: coffee or tea, two kinds of fruit juice, corn flakes with milk, prunes, several kinds of sweet and non-sweet breads, a variety of jams, honey, two or three choices of sliced meat and cheese, and fresh fruit (which many took for eating later). We always ate before 9 and never had to wait for a table. There were no eggs, but all in all the breakfast was as good as I have ever seen in a small, moderately priced European hotel -- and much better than most! Two negatives: the Internet system was not working (but there was an “Internet Point” in a bookstore just around the corner – open until 9PM) and the regular TV had only one Italian channel and an intermittent CNN. There was a pay TV system which we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but confusing...”
Reviews.Author: libbyanne
Reviews.Content: On booking into the Hotel Trevi we had to wait for hours-late afternoon until getting our room. We found ourselves not staying in the actual hotel but being taken up the road to a 5th floor studio. Quite roomy, very new and obviously not completed as electrical wiring had not been finished and joinery not completed. View was overlooking rooftops. Smallest lift ever one person and a bag is a tight fit. Went to breakfast room at the Hotel Trevi but walked out as very small and overcrowded. Location of hotel very close to Trevi fountain and walking distance to many sights. Were glad we had the studio as the hotel looked very compact. Staff not that friendly. Would recommend only for location.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked..”
Reviews.Author: turboand
Reviews.Content: Hotel was overbooked.. first night at another hotel, and the to following too night at "Hotel Trevi", we got a room outside the hotel in another building.

Reviews.Title: “Staff could not care less”
Reviews.Author: BackHomeAgain2
Reviews.Content: The good stuff - Great Location, easy walking distance of all major attractions. The bad stuff - practically everything else about the Hotel. It was hard to find (Taxi dropped us off in another road because access is bad), staff attitude was lousy - many of them could not or would not speak English. Room was tiny with cabin style bed barely big enough for my 6' 2" height, shower was small, unable to stand upright in it! Room not cleaned or serviced for 3 days, had to argue with reception staff to get clean towels. On 4th day room not serviced until argument with staff at 5:30 in the evening!! Panoramic breakfast room was unable to cope with full hotel and gave a view of sattelite dishes and chimney pots.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures say it”
Reviews.Author: Pankova
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio up the street for 4 nights. It was clean with second floor,quite small the problem was it was very gloomy - one window overlooking the back of a statue about 0.4 sq.meters(that will be 44 sq. feet). We just slept there quite tired so it didn't matter. Truth is, Rome is a location itself. Overall I found it very interesting place to stay - not the standart hotel room you are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location!”
Reviews.Author: Danijel I
Reviews.Content: Be extra careful when booking. They can tell you that they are overbooked and try to put you in a different hotel (they have five of them on other locations). After an argument we kept the fountain Trevi location but on a fourth floor in a building without elevator...

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend BUT wit Exceptions”
Reviews.Author: PapaBear54
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the hotel is well located, this was one of the reasons why we selected this hotel, however there were two specific requirements that we indicated in our initial selection in Expedia that were NOT met: AIR CONDITIONING ROOMS: the Air Conditioning system is very poor and inadequate to provide comfort. The electrical system in each room is controlled by a Key Card Switch, which turns on all electrical circuits in the room by inserting the room key once you access the room. We had to leave the key in the switch all day to have the room barely acconditioned at night when we returned. INTERNET ACCESS: I had to keep in touch with my office while I was away, therefore this was a requirement during my search. The hotel web site indicates that there is "dial-up internet port" in every room. That was NOT true. The hotel offers a very slow internet access in one little room next to the reception. The hotel is formed by very old residential buildings that have been adapted as a hotel. These buildings have been fitted Each with One very small elevators (can Barely fit One person with One suitcase in any of them), therefore be ready to go up Two to Four Stories carrying your suitcases. The Rooms are very small, but farely clean. My wife and I travelled with our two daughters (early twenties) which stayed in one room with one of our nieces (tripple room), and our two sons (teenagers) stayed with us in a Family Room. The Family room was supposed to have One Double and Two Twin Beds. The two doubles were actually together and the "Double" was actually a Sofa Bed opened with a very uncortable mattress and steel frame. The bathrooms were clean. In the girls room the water heater was malfunctioning, and the maintenance guy had problems making it work. The personnel at the front desk was variable, sometimes very helpful, and others were overwhelmed with the problems that the hotel had. As far as the breakfast is concerned, the ladies serving were very nice, but overwhelmed by the volume of guests that appeared during the last hour of breakfast. If you go early, 7:30 to 8:30 am there would be no problem. the breakfast consisted of bread buns, and croissants. ham, cheese, preserves, Juice and coffee. Last comment, the front desk recommendations were always tied to them making money from their recommendations. For instance the "Hop-on hop off" busses, there were no need for reservations, since they run all day from stop to stop, and the hotel made an "extra charge" with the pretense of making a "reservation" which was absolutely not necessary and/or existant. Go directly to Piazza Barberini and pay to the attendant as you hop on the bus, it will save you a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Location made it worth while.”
Reviews.Author: QueenieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. There were three of us - mother, father, and twenty-nine year old daughter. The room was on the small side with a nice bathroom and was always clean. The breakfast room is small, but when we went to eat there were never more than three other families in the room. The hotel staff were very accommodating to us and their suggestions on restaurants and tours all worked out well. Except for going to the Vatican every other attraction was easily within walking distance. The location of this hotel is its strongest draw and can't be beat. Our room was on the first floor and had its own private patio with table and chairs. The only English channel on TV was Fox News. My only negative would be the air conditioner. It was extremely hot in Italy when we were there and the A/C did not cool us enough. Being from California we are used to stronger air conditioners. The hotel's was more like an evaporative cooler which seemed to be the norm for the area stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Much maligned little gem.”
Reviews.Author: Discovered
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews about this hotel it was with some trepidation that we went to the Trevi Hotel in Rome. In short Rome is one of the most expensive cities on this earth to go and stay for a week, I was shocked at the cost of eating out or entering historic attractions, a quick tip, what ever monies you would take for a city break to London, treble it and then you will be ok in Rome. The hotel is as central as you can get and only fifty yards from the Trevi Fountain. We stayed in the main building in room 404 on the top floor, the hotel was small and clean, the staff helpful but I do appreciate that the brusk Italian way can be construed as aggressive, but that’s Italy not Bognor. From a cost point of view if you don’t like the Trvie then dig deep and stay somewhere else. My criticism if any would be the breakfast room has too many tables for the size of the room and when two thirds are in use the others can’t be used as they don’t have sufficient room between them. The breakfast is basic european style eating and quite enjoyable but again if you are looking for a three course menu with individual ingratiating service dig deep and go somewhere else. In summary you get exactly what it says on the tin, all too often brits go for two star and then whinge when its not five star. Many thanks to all at the Trevi, I would like to say, see you again, but unless the euro does some dramatic recovering against the pound that’s not likely. But finally for all who have gone before and found fault with the Trevi we stayed in the Heathrow Thistle on the way out and that was a disgrace and three times the price of the Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: VISJacksonvilleFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, just steps from the Trevi fountain but we found it very unsatisfactory. On the way into Rome we received conflicting information from the staff on whether we could bring our car to the hotel, costing us at least an hour in central Rome traffic. Reception and room check in took another hour. The breakfast room is very inadequate for the number of rooms. The front desk staff, when not on the phone and ignoring the person waiting at the desk, seemed totally uninterested in making a visit to Rome easy or pleasant. The room itself was OK for the price but a 5 floor walk-up on a busy street so that opening a window at night was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: catherine64
Reviews.Content: First let me say, Rome was beautiful, the people friendly and proud of this city. At the Hotel Trevi we booked to stay a full two weeks. Were it not for the excellent service we received from Gianfranco and Massimo we would have left the next day due to the rather snide, rude service we received from one Sonya at the front desk who chose to lock us out of our room on our first day so that we may settle the entire bill. Her attitude was beyond anything we had seen as "well seasoned" travellers. But back to the hotel, it is clean, close to everything, rooms a bit small, close to everything, rather pricey, but still.......close to everything. Catherine

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelh265
Reviews.Content: If you're only staying for a couple of nights then this hotel is ok. Our room was located in an apartment block opposite the hotel on around the 3rd floor. So you had a little bit of a walk to get to breakfast in the morning. - Speaking of which if you're disabled or injured I wouldnt suggest this hotel as there isnt a lift to the breakfast room, you have to walk up a small narrow flight of stairs. The location however was excellent, postitioned round the corner from the Trevi fountain you're only a short walk away from Rome's main attractions. The furthest being the vatican which took about 20 mins. The room itself was quite quaint although we had a very loud water tank stored in a locked closet which liked to drip quite a lot whilst your trying to sleep. And unfortunatly for us we had a family in the room adjacent with kids that thought it was fun to run up & down the corridor and scream as loud as possible.

Reviews.Title: “2 * STANDARD, CLEAN - SMALL - EAT ELSEWHERE !”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyEng
Reviews.Content: This is a two star hotel, perfect location you can walk to all the major sites, however the rooms are very small, the shower even smaller. The one overwhelming downside was breakfast, awful and very cramped seating. The juice was foul and there was rotting fruit openly on show, don't waste your time unless you are desperate for a cup of tea. Just around the corner from the hotel towards the Trevi there is a fast food sandwich shop which actually serves a really good cheap continental breakfast. If you are just looking for a clean room and bed then this place is fine else spend a little more and go elsewhere. Oh one last thing do not try and find it yourself, get a taxi, its so hidden away.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: wanderingman_9
Reviews.Content: We paid 177 euro ($234) per night at this "3 star" hotel: you could do better. Pro's: 1) Steps from Trevi fountain 2) Nice breakfast room on the rooftop (get there early to avoid the crowd) . Con's: 1) No hot water in our room from midnight to about 6:30 AM. We complained several days in a row, but the manager kept saying "it's impossible" because we were the only ones in the hotel complaining. Even the 3rd shift desk staff observed it, but we could not get it fixed. 2) Internet didn't work and TV was intermittent. I think the satellite dish was out of alignment, but they hadn't fixed it the 5 days I was there. 3) No refunds if you leave early..we tried to check out early due to dissatisfaction, but were told that we would have to pay for entire stay. Street noise at night

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Paris064
Reviews.Content: A horrid, dirty hotel, with a rude manager. We had a room away from the main hotel (most of their rooms are outside of the main hotel), hardly any light (tiny windows near the ceiling, as if we were in a basement!), a layer of dust and grime over the furniture! We asked for another room - were shown one that hadn't seen a vacuum cleaner in years! The manager refused to refund us and was rude as well! This hotel should be avoided at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jankovsky
Reviews.Content: Amazing location 20 metres from trevi fountain, we were in the second bulding, would reccommend for young couples. Not quite clean and breakfast are served only in main building. Highly reccommed restaurant Chianti right next to the hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: London_Scooter71
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for more, the hotel is just of the main street from the Trevi Fountain, so one of the top attractions of Rome is right on your door step. It is a little noisy, we were in one of their rooms off the main building so the room was accessed off the street. At night we heard everything, but on the plus side the room was beautiful and clean. The staff on the reception desk wasn't too helpful, she was very slow and a little rude but that didn't put us off, I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: adymolloy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, well decorated and they all have balconies. The bathroom is big. Everything was clean. Two steps from the trevi fountain, the hotel is located at the heart of the city. The personal was kind and the breakfast reasonable. Nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rude management”
Reviews.Author: neon8tl1
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation for this hotel through this site. They immediately emailed to state that the room we booked was not a nice room and they could offer us a better room at 20 euros more a night. After reading these reviews on trip advisor we had concerns about the experience at this hotel. So we cancelled. In letting the hotel know that they should review these reviews and try to correct problems this is their answer: "OK perfect, I think it’s better for you and specially for us, people like you are not welcome…" . Apparently tourists are not welcome if they alert the staff to problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice experience”
Reviews.Author: saxofone
Reviews.Content: Well located, near Fontana de Trevi and other interesting places in Roma, you don't need a car or a bus to go around. Piaza D'Espagna, Via del Corso, Via Condoti... it's all there in a five minute walking... we can also visit the Coliseum in a 20 minute walking... I stay in a room outside the main building of the hotel, a spacious room, cleanned everyday, good bathroom, nice reconstruction... did not have any breakfast in the principal building, but someone told me it's Ok for the price we pay. If I went again to Roma , and I did put a coin in Fontana de Trevi.. ahaha... I will look for this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: travellin_fam4
Reviews.Content: This hotel put us in a central location as we were able to walk to all major sights in Rome. The staff was extremely helpful, the only thing I didn't appreciate was that they tried to sell us on a couple of over priced tours. They were not pushy though, and were very understanding when we declined. Rooms were very large by European standards and exceptionally clean. The hotel consists of two buildings, one of which has (I'm guessing) five floors, and there is no elevator. Not a problem for us, but if you need the elevator I recommend asking for the main building. Breakfast was good, all of the typical continental breakfast fare, but the room did get a bit crowded so get there early! All in all, this was a wonderful hotel, and I would definitely stay there again if we return to Rome. The highlight for me was without doubt opening my window and falling to sleep to the splashing waters of the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; decent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Hoya_Lawya_NJ
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hotel Trevi two years ago -- I booked it online at the last minute on Orbitz or Travelocity (I dont remember which one) (strangely, when I called the hotel directly, they said they had no rooms).
