Any way. The location was great -- very close to the Trevi Fountain, in the heart of Rome. The room was alright; beds were a big saggy. However, Rome is a beautiful, fun city, and this Hotel is a good spot to rest your head when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelArkansas
Reviews.Content: When we checked into this hotel we were informed immediately that they were overbooked so they tried to convince us that we were getting "upgraded to an apartment". What they didn't tell us was that the apartment was a block up from the hotel with a door that opened to the alleyway without any windows. We had to stay at this hotel for 3 nights with a staff that was extremely rude to us our entire stay. After 2 weeks in Italy staying in multiple hotels this was by far the worst. Finally, we scheduled an airport transfer through the hotel the night before we left and were repeatedly assured by the front desk that the transfer company accepted credit cards. Then the morning of our taxi was 15 minutes late and informed us that they did not accept credit cards. The lady at the front desk seemed annoyed when we asked her to call the transfer company to see where they were. I hate that we had to end such a fabulous vacation with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lozbarrow
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Hotel Trevi 10-13 June 2008 and didn't know what to expect. We stayed in a double room outside the hotel, but was only 5 metres away. The Reception staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were great. Tidy and with a very modern bathroom. Breakfast was continental and couldn't be faulted. For location this place cannot be beaten. We walked everywhere from here and were less than 100 metres from the Trevi Fountain. Even though we were this close it was very quiet at night. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WineGirl3
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a room and we found it very small. They provided us with a roll away and two twins pushed together. I think they could have offered something better. I had a great deal of difficulty working with one of the desk clerks before my arrival. I could never get a confirmation for my pick-up from the airport to the hotel so we were stuck waiting once we arrived. Then when we called to ask a question they were a bit rude. The shower in our room was extremely small, every time I lifted my arms I turned off the water. So if you are a bit on the large side you'll have problems. From reading the others reviews it appears they have larger bathrooms so stay away from room 301. Hotel Trevi offered a decent breakfast on the roof top, which did get pretty crowded after 9:00. Everything is expensive in Rome so to have one meal you didn't have to pay for was nice. Aside from that and sounding unhappy......our stay was good because really we only needed a place to rest our heads and would stay there again. The staff was extremely helpful and very accomodating. The location was perfect and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: mabock
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! They gave us an outside room, in the next buildind. That was great, quiet street , big room, big bathroom. Staff was very nice, and breakfast was perfect! I would recomend it to my friends and family, the price is very good, as it's VERY CLOSE to Fontana di Trevi, so we could go there anytime, every day in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Small but excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Mordechaivanunu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Trevi from 13th-17th April 2008, and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel, after reading some reviews of this hotel. The location was excellent (only approx 200 yards from the Trevi fountain) and also good for other attractions in Rome (we walked to everything that we wanted to see (Colloseum, Vatican Zoo, Museum Borhese, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Vittorio Emanuele Monument etc) and nothing was more than 30-40 minutes walk away. Room was clean, good sized shower in bathroom, and all towels etc where changed every day. Air conditioning worked well and was quiet. The only negatives I would say were that the rooms where on the small side (although I understand not a unusual thing for Rome). The selection at breakfast was a bit limited (even to have some facility to do/have toast would have been enough really). Also in the mornings it could get a bit noisy in the street outside as people went about their work, this would not be a problem if you slept with the window closed, as double glazing good. Also would recommend for shuttle from airport www.romeshuttlelimousine.com excellent service nice polite drivers and good value (35 euro's each way). Once again was pleasantly surprised by this hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and economical”
Reviews.Author: 7034lithopolis
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located and clean. I would call it a boutique hotel. The breakfast food had healthy alternatives and the room, on the top floor, provided a nice rooftop view of the area. Our room had a private patio with table and umbrella. Very nice. John Franco, the desk manager, he said he was not related to the Reds/Mets pitcher, was very helpful. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room smelled awful”
Reviews.Author: larrysheets
Reviews.Content: positives: --location of hotel --price --staff was very friendly negatives: --standard room was absolutely tiny. no storage space and probably about a foot and a half walking space on two sides of double bed and maybe 3 feet on third side. that's it. --the room smelled terrible. i think it was the plumbing drain lines. smelled like sewer. they "fixed" it but the smell would come back and then they would "fix" it again. i think they just dumped a lot of lemon-scented chemicals down the drain. we stayed one night in one of the deluxe rooms. these have a little more room to them. if you stay here, definitely get the upgraded room. it has a king size bed too. this room did not smell. i would have been pleased with the place if we would have stayed in this room the entire trip. WHATEVER YOU DO, STAY AWAY FROM ROOM 206. I AM NOT KIDDING.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: JosephineEssex
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent location within walking distance to all main tourist attractions of Rome, including shops and some excellent cafes, restaurants nearby. Rooms very small but very clean, although there are some of the hotel rooms which are outside of the main building which are huge in comparison. Breakfast is not great and is served in Terrace Room on top floor which is very small and cramped. Went for coffee as have no coffee making facilities in room then ventured to a cafe for breakfast!! Found hotel staff to be very friendly but a few tips: 1. Receptionist will encourage you to go on trips recommending the morning and afternoon one with lunch. Definately well worth it especially if its your first time in Rome but don't go for all day ones with lunch - lunch is rubbish and not worth the money!!! Book the trips separate and find somewhere to lunch yourselves. 2. The taxi's from the airport are a fixed price of 30 Euros - if asking reception to book cab for your return trip to airport ensure they book the cabs with fixed rate of 30 Euros otherwise you'll get a chauffeur driven car costing 52 Euros!!!!! 3. Always remember to order potatoes, salad or veg with meal otherwise if you order steak, just steak is what you'll get!!! But all in all a lovely little hotel but don't expect luxury as that is not what you'll get. There is no place in the hotel to sit and have coffee or a drink but plenty nearby - the location of this hotel is the only benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: aquatics
Reviews.Content: After reading the highly varied reviews on this hotel here, it was with some anticipation we (myself, wife and two kids) arrived for our 4 night stay. What a pleasant surprise we got! This was my fifth trip to Rome, and I have stayed in everything from 3 to 5 star hotels. The Hotel Trevi was clearly above average for its star raiting as Roman hotels are conserned. We got a spacious quadruple room in an other building (probably 17th century), close to the reception building - and the entrance was directly from the street. However, the room was exciting and beautiful, with massive original oak beams in the ceiling. The bathroom was modern and of good standard, even though the water pressure in the shower could have been better. Overall cleanliness was good. Aircon functioned satsfactorily and was fairly quiet. Despite our door opening directly to the street (had good security lock), we were not at all bothered by noice. Even though there were crowds of people in the area, very few entered this narrow back alley. We did not have any view from our window (curtains were in fact drawn all the time, since we were on street level), but who misses a room with a view when you have some of the most exciting and beautiful sights in the world one minute (Trevi fountain) to five minutes (Pantheon) to ten minutes (Piazza Navona and Spanish Steps) walk from your door step?! The breakfast room on the fourth floor of the main (reception) building was on the small side, with too many tables and chairs stuck in a small space - but we always found an empty table no matter what time we had our breakfast. The selection of food was not at all impressive, but still better than average for Roman hotels in this price category (even much more expensive hotels can have lower quality). The staff were slow at cleaning tables, but again, that didn't really trouble us. Will definitely try this hotel again some other time!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms and faiirly basic but location FAB!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome twice. On my first visit I stayed at Nuovo Hotel Quattro Fontane, the second time I stayed here at the Hotel Trevi. Despite being a lower graded hotel I actually preferred it here! The reason?? Location, location location! Rooms are very small, only about a foot or two (max) around the double bed but very clean and well furnished. The breakfast on the roof is pretty poor (we arrived late after a lay in and everything had gone!) but you cannot beat the location for a budget hotel. Some great little cafes just around the corner for a late night coffee or liquer or both and right in front of the fountain! Like everything in life you get what you pay for - just don't expect any form of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Location - great! Hotel - terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkhearts
Reviews.Content: What a great location - but that's where it ends! The hotel rooms are small and fairly noisey. We had persistent problems with our stay. Double bed booked to celebrate wedding anniversay - we got two single beds - complained - pushed beds together! Airconditioning not working when we arrived for our six night stay and still not working when we left, despite many reports to reception desk and attempts to fix, including knocking part of our bedroom wall about whilst we were out for day! Airconditioning problems in breakfast room, maintenance man made repairs over the buffet breakfast in the morning!!!! Dirty table clothes not changed and hotel in general not overly clean (I do have failry high standard in this area!). Breakfast ok, not much variety, especially basics like cereal etc and very cramped seating area. Reception booked us a trip to Ostia to see a "lovely harbour" - cost us 170 euro and we were dropped no where near a harbour, nor did we find one after walking miles - beware! When we got back to hotel to complain they didn't want to know and lady behind desk was very unhelpful and rude! Key to room didn't work a number of times and you had to get it re-set at reception, nor did phone in room. Rome itself was great, lots to see and easy to get to everything from this hotel but would avoid it as you are paying a high price for location and not for the hotel! Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but quirky”
Reviews.Author: Cranley66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the warren of narrow streets around the Trevi fountain. It is within 15 to 30 minutes walk of all the main attractions and 2 minutes from the main bus routes on Via Corso and Del Tritone. The main part is a narrow 4 storey old building, probably not built as a hotel and before the en-suite bathroom and plumbing were thought of but they shoe-horned them in. Just don't look at the electric wiring but it all seems to work. We were in room 503, which is the gound floor of a building 50 yards up the street and round the corner in Via Scanderbeg. This room was originally a store or workshop for the family upstairs. As such it has a high vaulted ceiling with small windows high up and doesn't really need the air-con; a fan would have been nice. It's a big room with comfortable beds, a table, sofa-bed, small fridge/mini-bar, a large shower room and built in wall safe. As the room opens straight onto the street, the nearest restaurant (a nice quiet one) is exactly twelve paces from your bed but you will be woken early by the scooters and pop-pops roaring past. Breakfast on the rooftop of the main building was just fine and the waitresses helpful. In fact all the staff in their own way were helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CheshireMike
Reviews.Content: Date: 19th April 2007 We recently stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and had a comfortable stay. After reading some of the negative reviews we wondered what we were going to. On arrival we were greeted by a friendly receptionist making check in easy. The room (3rd floor) was comfortable and the bedding /towels clean and changed daily. The breakfast room is cramped but the food was fresh. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is central to most attractions and passing the 'Fontana de Trevi' every morning was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience at Hotel Trevi”
Reviews.Author: gardengirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I was very unhappy with my stay. On the first full day of my arrival my brand new DVD camera was stolen from my room. Although I understand that hotel properties are not responsible for stolen items I was treated very rudely by the staff when I reported the incident. Addtionally I was asked to leave my room key at the front desk that morning with no explanation given. Upon my return that evening the door was ajar and the camera missing. The safe in the room did not work and when this was reported the staff attempted but were unable to fix it. There was alot of construction and repair work going on and an awful odor coming from the room next door. There was definitely a lack of hotel staff to assist with the morning breakfasts. I would not recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: madmurdoch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for the first time at this hotel for its central location. Having read some of the reviews on this website after booking I have to say I was a little worried. We didnt need to be. We were given a room outside the hotel which was on two levels, bedroom en sute and door to our own private garden downstairs and sitting room upstairs. The breakfast room had the most amazing view over the rooftops of Rome and was quite basic but plenty of it. We would not hesitate to stay here again for its great location and totally acceptable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “The one we didn't stay at !”
Reviews.Author: van1canuck
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for a five night stay. We arrived by taxi and introduced ourselves. Immediately we were advised that there was a refrigeration problem at the hotel (??) and we were to be moved to another owned by the same company - the same quality and price and still relatively near the centre. The woman at the desk was brusque and not at all apologetic - as though we were privileged to be allowed on to the premises anyway ! She called us a 'taxi' (scruffy driver and grubby vehicle) to take us to the alternative hotel -Quattro Fontane. (which was undergoing noisy renovations. That's another story !) Our feeling having seen other reviews of this hotel is that they regularly trade on their name and overbook, then shunt customers to their other premises in the 'Trevi group.' Most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: lainsa2
Reviews.Content: If you are in Rome to see and experience the city, this is the place to stay. Not for couples but perfect for friends. Nice restaurants around, execellent pizzas... And a chance to see Fontana di Trevi every day! And I really loved those croissants at the breakfasts... Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: BristowLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Couple from Liverpool, UK Booked via Cresta holiday My husband and I stayed at this hotel 9th - 12th January 2007 and were more than happy with the accomadation. After reading previous reviews I got the hotel to confirm that our room was in the main residence and not the apartments they offer as an alternative. The room was small but clean bathroom was small but again very clean. The breakfast was alot to be desired and on our fiirst morning I think they had forgotten to fill up the juice machine as it was very watery and disgusting. We skipped breakfast the next morning but on our final morning tried again and the juice was acceptable coffee is fowl so the lady kindly made us a cappucino.The food is sufficient. We found the staff courteous enough, but to be honest after breakfasr we were out all day back at 6 siesta and back out again to the early hours so we never really needed to speak to the staff anyway. It is an ideal hotel if your Rome visit is to view all the sights in a short amount of time. The location is superb and the hotel is ideal. I would definately return especially as it was so reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly staff and other problems”
Reviews.Author: margaretNewcastle
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i booked three nights for two at the Trevi via Cresta Holidays. initially we thought hotel was ok - quaint and just off the Trevi fountain. in fact the location was great. the staff however were particularly unfriendly and unhelpful. i put this down to neither of us being able to speak Italian at first but even efforts to say hello and goodbye made little difference. as a result we felt inhibited from asking for help or advice. we also realised that our ground floor room was next to the laundry and that our only window opened onto it. Needless to say we kept both the window and the curtains shut. On the last day we found the staff had opened our window from the laundry side with the result that we had a rather nasty experience with a cockroach like beetle we assumed had got in from the laundry. all in all despite the great location i could not recommend this hotel. If we were given poor accommodation because we only paid for 2 nights then i would suggest that they stop accepting that type of booking.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues”
Reviews.Author: Fitzroy
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at the Trevi hotel a few years ago and recommended it. Decided to stay here with my girlfriend cos of the price (110 Euros/night dbb) and location despite some interesting comments on this website. Had a fantastic time in Rome but there were a few problems with the hotel. First night we were put in a room on the 3rd floor which had a problem with the plumbing- bathroom actually smelt of sewage. The room was worn out and cramped with poor ventilation. Bought this up in the morning and luckily had one room we could change to. This room was in a separate building to the hotel, nearer the Trevi fountain and was four flights up withh no lift. Again small but at least it was newly refurbished and had a balcony and no smelly bathroom! So the next day, the power kept on failing. We had no lights, shower, anything. Even the emergency lighting didnt work after a while. Told the guy at reception who said he would sort it out for us and went out for the evening. Of course he didnt do anything about it and we just slept and decided to sort it out in the morning. The receptionists are pretty useless and patronising. The receptionist in the morning seemed keen to help and said she would send someone up while we had our breakfast. This wasnt the case but eventually a guy came over to the room and sorted it in about half an hour. Finally we also had problems with the key cards which seem to stop working every now and again. Loads of people seemed to be getting this and it is a bit of a pain when your room 4 flights up in a different building to the hotel. At least it was good exercise! Anyway, like i said before, it was a BRILLIANT holiday, Rome is amazing! If you are the sort of person that would get wound up by this sort of thing then dont stay at hotel trevi. We took all this stuff in our stride and didnt complain as everything was eventually sorted out and it really didnt effect our stay because we just got on with having fun. The location is great and i expect you could get lucky and not have any probs. Good if you are young and flexible!!

Reviews.Title: “Over booked the room!”
Reviews.Author: wrach
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome after quite a long day of travelling and when we finally got to the Hotel Trevi, we were told that there was a "water" problem in our room and that we would have to stay in another hotel for the first night. At this point, my boyfriend and I felt like screaming as we had read about this happening on this site but believed we may have some good luck as there seems to be more good than bad reviews for Hotel Trevi. I have to be honest, I expected to be put up in the worst hotel for out first night but it was a lovely, 4 star hotel but right across town. We were then took back to the Hotel Trevi in the morning and there was a different receptionist on who said the maid's were just getting the room ready showing that there was no water problem and in fact, had overbooked the room! So we were lied too! Which wasnt very pleasent, I would of preferred the truth. The stay overall was nice and it was a good hotel to be based in as was only basic. Plus, I would be careful of room 402 as we couldnt lock it for most of our stay and only banged it shut on the final night. So we were walking about during the day, worrying about whether our items were okay back in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Isaac17
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12th to 18th November. Reading other reviews, it seems that it’s a bit hit and miss where you end up staying. We were put in accommodation on the nearby via Lavatore. The room was fine: a decent size, plenty of storage space, a good bathroom with full-sized bath (which I’d specifically asked for), and a small balcony overlooking the via Lavatore. The street noise was very minor – not a bother at all. There was also a TV (couldn’t locate an English-speaking channel), safe & phone. The only problem was the unreliable key cards: it’s no fun coming home after a hard day’s sightseeing, up 4 flights of stairs, to find that the key card won’t let you into the room. I got the impression it was a frequent problem – it happened twice to us. Good location for reaching any of the sights. Plenty of places around to eat. Recommended restaurant: the Piccolo Arancio, on the vicolo Skanderbeg nearby (friendly staff and excellent food: quality Italian, not tourist – not a pizza on the menu).

Reviews.Title: “Lied to, deceived, and cheated - and we weren't alone”
Reviews.Author: MONTYBOY
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of it's location, a stone throw from the Trevi fountain. We however made what turned out to be the big mistake of prepaying, through our tour agent, for the rooms. Unfortunately, we didn't get to stay in the hotel on either of our two nights in Rome. We arrived to be told that 'they had problems', which meant of course they'd done the old trick of overbooking a central hotel, and then shipping you off to some other residence. After an age of arguments and wrangling, we eventually cut our losses and went to their alternative room, which was 'beautiful and close by' It was a twenty five minute taxi ride away, a windowless basement flat, in a private residence, in a side street, still covered in scaffolding, which would never have passed EU H & S requirements for a hotel room. The room has first class facilties, they said - it had none of the facilities you'd expect in a hotel room, it was a basically furnished private bedsit. We need 2 keys to the room. No problem we have given you 2 they said - they hadn't, just separate keys for the 3 metal grilles we had to unlock to get in ! Ring us to be picked up for breakfast, they said - not even a phone in the room ! Luckily we knew Rome, and had a spattering of Italian - if this had been a first time visit, for a less travel savvy person it could have completely ruined a weekend. We went back to the hotel to complain and found the front desk manned by someone else who helpfully told us 'this is your problem, not ours!' We decided to make the best of a bad job and enjoy the city that night. The next morning when we returned to the hotel, we refused point blank to return to the bedsit, and eventually after more arguing and wrangling got the offer of another 'apartment' much closer to the hotel. Given it's location - much closer to the original hotel - and it's facitlties - it at least had a phone, a mini bar, although it was still largely windowless - and the fact we didn't want to spend even more of our limited weekend arguing or finding somewhere else to stay, we took it. During our time at the check in and at the remote bedsit, we came across four other parties who had been overbooked, and switched - so this was no 'unusual' event ! So beware - your nice, centrally located, well equipped Rome hotel could turn out to be something very different. Book in here at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: FriscoKid49er
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Trevi is not a five star luxury hotel. But if is very comfortable, offers a great morning breakfast, and the location can't be beat. A friend and I stayed for three nights. She had never been to Rome before and Trevi is within walking distance of the Pantheon, Roman Forum, Colesseum, Campo di Fiori. It is also easy to get to the Vatican and Spanish Steps. And, or course, it is only a few hundred feet from the Trevi Fountain, so you can't get lost. And everyone who worked there was extremely helpful. High recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tess&pen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break to the Hotel Trevi in Rome, Italy. The hotel is in a fantastic location just a few yards from the Trevi Fountain. We stayed in the annex just round the corner and across from the side of the Trevi. The room was large with a double bed and a double sofa plus dressing table etc. The shower room was well stocked but there was no bath. Linen and towels were changed daily. All other tourist sites are within easy walking distance as we found out when we went on the open top bus tour, 12euros each for 2hour trip. Continental breakfast is served in the roof top terrace which overlooks other rooftops but wasn't a problem for us. Choice was limited but there was ample food. Although the terrace is small we went between 8AM-9AM and never had a problem with seating or service. The only problem was a winding staircase up to the terrace which could be a problem for people with limited mobility. All the staff speak English and were most helpful. If you have made your own way there the hotel can arrange for taxi transfers back to the airport for 52Euros for 4 people. There are lots of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance with a variety of prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay and what a location!”
Reviews.Author: skozub
Reviews.Content: We were given a room outside of the hotel in a private residence. It was the largest suite I have ever staying in while in Europe. The suite was just up the street from the Trevi Fountain. We had out own key and came and went without any problems. We had breakfast in the main hotel each morning. The food was better than most of the other hotels we dined at. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They helped us out last minute when other reservations fell through at Hotel Fontana (I do NOT recommend these people at Hotel Fontana...I felt cheated). They worked with us on cost and gave us a discount on the room. I would stay here again. I think this was a fantastic location (although, I'd recommend you check into Hotel Abruzzi if you want location...it is right across from the Pantheon and was the best location I have found).

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Hotel Trevi”
Reviews.Author: Anthony059
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Trevi two weeks ago, sharing a room with three other ladies. The room was comfortably large, mini bar, good shower, clean sheets and t.v. - everything was more than satisfacory. We didn't stay in the hotel, we were in the annexe around the corner - in a way it was like staying in a flat. Staff were reasonably helpful, especially the lady serving the delicious breakfasts. The main thing about the Trevi Hotel is the fabulous location - its so close to all the tourist spots. It is by no means a luxury hotel but had everything we needed to make us comfortable - especially the fact that we could walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Hotel Trevi”
Reviews.Author: jakedylan2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trevi Hotel in October 2004. We went on an overnight trip to Capri while leaving our belongings at the hotel, and when we got back, we had been robbed. We had our passports, money and euros in the safe, and when we returned, the safe and mini-bar (to which the safe was bolted) had disappeared. The concierge could not have cared less about our dilemma, even though we had to WALK to the police station to file a report; and we had to WALK to the American Embassy to get new passports. We were in one of the ground level "annex rooms" . . no sign of forced entry!! Everyone there seemed to have a key . . . no forced entry was necessary. To this date, we have not heard ONE WORD from the hotel, of concern, apology, whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hertzdonut
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Hotel Trevi and had a wonderful stay. We had a triple room and it was the biggest room we experienced out of 5 hotels across Europe. The room opened directly into a beautiful walkway in Rome and it was as if we had our own apartment. If there were any complaints regarding the hotel it would be that there was only a small hot water tank in our hotel bathroom with barely enough hot water for 3 showers. There were no English language channels on the TV and the breakfast room is indeed small but you will only spend 10-20 minutes in the room a day anyway.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay at the trevi hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When deciding on where to stay I always check 'trip advisor' for opinions before I book. On booking a girls weekend away I had decided on the 'trevi hotel' for location but the poor reviews put me off. However, I decided to go with my gut feeling and booked this hotel anyway and we weren't disappointed! The day before departure I wanted to change our room bookings as the party number had changed - I contacted Cresta who I had booked with and they said I could not change the booking as the hotel was fully booked and that they charge to make changes anyway. I contacted the hotel direct and they were polite, efficient, spoke sufficient English and accomodated my request without any problem (and no charge!). Our rooms were very comfortable (one of which was great and in apartments opposite), clean and the reception staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Great location and very quiet, and only steps from the fountain. Only small gripe - breakfast room is tiny and you may need to wait 10 mins for table at busier times which really wasn't a problem. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLoftMaindstone
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Hotel Trevi. The Location is second to none, 30 seconds from the Trevi Fountain and no more than a 20 minute walk from all the other Rome sites. The rooms are very clean and well appointed with every facility you would expect from a good hotel. We stayed in one of the appartments just out side of the main reception lobby 30 yrds along the georgous cobbled pedestrian street. Breakfast is continental style and of very good quality (cheese, meats, bread, croissant, cerials, fruit etc.) although the basement room it's served in is small and has a limited number of tables, so you may need to wait for a table at peak times, try to get there before 9am and you should have no problem. Ignor the reviews saying that this hotel deliberatley over books to ensure it is full and "ships" you off to a sister hotel miles outside of the city centre. Even if this is true the sister hotel is about 500 yrds from this one, so hardly a disaster!! All the staff are very friendly and helpful, try using a little Italian and you'll get a greater reception still! All of the hotel staff spoke excellent English so even if your not happy trying to "go native" you'll have no problem. The reception staff were particularly helpful, arranging taxis, restaurant bookings etc. When we return to Rome, as we certainly intend to, we'll look no further than the Hotel Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The overall service received at this hotel was completely unacceptable. The front desk was extremely rude and unhelpful and gave us a really major problem. Even the maids and breakfast server were unfriendly. Avoid this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “changed room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got the room 101 at the lift but we did´nt accept it (we had read about it in Trip-advisor that it was noisy) so at last we got a nice apartment in a building just on the other side of the street. It was on the 2:d floor with lift, a large and nice room so we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome, Wonderful Trevi”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trevi Hotel with my husband and two year daughter for three nights. When we arrived at the hotel we were told our room wasn't ready (perfectly acceptable as this was only 12 noon, we were told to come back at 1.30pm. I was slightly apprenhensive having read other reviews that we would be shipped off to another hotel. When we arrived back at the hotel we would told the room would be ready in five mins. Whilst we were waiting another family off three people arrived and were told that they were staying at the sister hotel!!!! (Glad we got there early!!) We were shown to Europa apartment in the block next to the hotel. Nice room, immaculately clean, fantastic shower, air conditioning brilliant, twin beds and a camp bed style double (very comfy). We all slept like logs. The room was quite dark as only one tiny window so we had to have a light on all the time. Breakfast was OK, the waitress was miserable, but the rooftop setting was lovely. Hotel can arrange taxi back to the airport for 46 Euros. Absolutely perfect location, very close to the Trevi fountain just up a little sidestreet (wouldn't want to have been any closer as VERY busy all day and night. Walking distance to all the major sites. Rome is so beautiful. We will definately stay at the Trevi hotel again (hoping they have a room for us).
